chinese: (fml.) affect sb. / sth. in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer 折磨；使痛苦
examples: e.g. I understand the burdens that [[afflict]] your family, and I pledge to you my efforts to help overcome them.

chinese: (threat, attack, or warning) not direct but is easily understood （威胁、攻击或警告）隐含的，不明言的
examples: e.g. They launched a thinly [[veiled]] attack on his ability as a leader.

chinese: prevent from being seen or discovered 隐瞒；掩盖
examples: e.g. Why did you decide to [[conceal]] your true identity?

chinese: do or say sth. quickly or without delay 赶紧做（或说）
examples: e.g. I [[hastened]] to assure her that there was no danger of falling down from the bridge.；e.g. There are, in theory, many ways to [[hasten]] economic recovery after a financial crisis.

chinese: vt.make sth. happen faster or sooner 加速；加紧
examples: e.g. I [[hastened]] to assure her that there was no danger of falling down from the bridge.；e.g. There are, in theory, many ways to [[hasten]] economic recovery after a financial crisis.

chinese: prevent sth. from happening or prevent sb. from doing sth. by doing sth. first 预先阻止；在（他人）之前行动 ; 先发制人
examples: e.g. My mother tells me that to [[forestall]] is better than to amend and prevention is better than cure.

chinese: 1) gentle and careful in a way that shows love 温柔的；体贴入微的
examples: e.g. He was a rebel, but a strong part of him was sensitive and [[tender]], just as his sister.；e.g. Cook for a minimum of two hours, or until the meat is [[tender]].

chinese: 2) (food) easily cut and eat, esp. because it has been well cooked （食物）软的，嫩的，易咀嚼的
examples: e.g. He was a rebel, but a strong part of him was sensitive and [[tender]], just as his sister.；e.g. Cook for a minimum of two hours, or until the meat is [[tender]].

chinese: (wept, wept) cry because you feel unhappy or have some other strong emotion 哭泣；流泪
examples: e.g. Wonderfully melodic and tuneful, his songs have made the audience [[weep]].

chinese: 1) (~ yourself to sth.) feel an emotion so strongly that you let it control you completely 陷入（某种感情）
examples: e.g. We are scared to [[abandon]] ourselves to our feelings in case we seem weak or out of control.；e.g. He can never forgive his mother because she [[abandoned]] him when he was five years old.

chinese: 2) leave sb. when you should stay with them and look after them 抛弃；遗弃
examples: e.g. We are scared to [[abandon]] ourselves to our feelings in case we seem weak or out of control.；e.g. He can never forgive his mother because she [[abandoned]] him when he was five years old.

chinese: [U] a complete surrender of inhibitions 放任；放纵
examples: e.g. In some poetry, sensitivity, she suggests, "has led to a dangerous [[abandonment]] to sensation."

chinese: [C] 扶手椅
[U] a feeling of being extremely tired and without energy 筋疲力尽；疲惫不堪
examples: e.g. Weak with [[exhaustion]], the climbers were finally rescued by a helicopter after being trapped in heavy snow.

chinese: 1) continue to cause problems for a person or organization for a long time 缠扰；纠缠
examples: e.g. The shame of being a bankrupt is likely to [[haunt]] Mr. Lucas for the rest of his life.；e.g. They say the prison is [[haunted]] by the ghosts of the men who died there.

chinese: 2) if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often （鬼魂）经常出没于
examples: e.g. The shame of being a bankrupt is likely to [[haunt]] Mr. Lucas for the rest of his life.；e.g. They say the prison is [[haunted]] by the ghosts of the men who died there.

chinese: [pl.] things that are for sale, usu. not in a shop （一般不在商店内出售的）商品，货物
examples: e.g. The major off-line brands aren't promoting their [[wares]] on the Internet as much as expected.

chinese: in a way that is difficult to see, hear, smell, etc. 不清楚地；模糊地
examples: e.g. When the piano fell silent, the sound of the traffic echoed [[faintly]] in the room.

chinese: [C] 麻雀
(of birds) make a lot of short high sounds （鸟）鸣啭
[pl.] 屋檐
[C] a small area of sth. that is different from the area around it （与周围部分不同的）小片，小块
examples: e.g. Belinda watched a [[patch]] of sunlight move slowly across the wall.

chinese: [C] 垫子；靠垫；坐垫
[C] an act or sound of sobbing 抽噎（声）；啜泣（声）；呜咽（声）
examples: e.g. After a while, she began to [[sob]] again, burying her face in the pillow.

chinese: vi.cry noisily while taking short breaths 抽噎；啜泣
examples: e.g. After a while, she began to [[sob]] again, burying her face in the pillow.

chinese: (bespoke, bespoken) show or suggest sth. 显示；表示
examples: e.g. Her house, her clothes, her style of living, all [[bespeak]] an exceedingly good income.

chinese: stop yourself from doing sth. you want to do 忍住；克制
examples: e.g. She could not [[repress]] a smile at this, but she answered only by nodding her head slightly.

chinese: [U] the behavior of sb. who refuses to show or admit strong feelings that they have （对感情的）抑制，压抑
examples: e.g. He told her that emotional [[repression]] was preventing her from understanding her own behavior.

chinese: [sing.] a long steady look 凝视；注视
examples: e.g. She felt embarrassed under his steady [[gaze]].

chinese: over there 在那边（的）；在远处（的）
examples: e.g. Now look [[yonder]], just beyond the wooden post — there's a white cottage under the hill.

chinese: [U] when sth. is officially stopped for a period of time 暂停；中止
examples: e.g. Anyway, we have to admit that both sides are now working toward a [[suspension]] of hostility.

chinese: not obvious, and therefore difficult to notice 细微的；微妙的；难以察觉的
examples: e.g. I sensed a [[subtle]] change in his attitude toward us.

chinese: difficult to find or not often seen 难找的；不常见到的
examples: e.g. Who can tell me how to catch the [[elusive]] charm of the original version in translation?

chinese: (crept, crept) move slowly and quietly 轻声地缓慢行进
examples: e.g. When cats are preparing to pounce on (猛扑) the mouse, they [[creep]] over the ground very slowly.

chinese: [C] a particular smell, esp. a pleasant one 气味；（尤指）香味
examples: e.g. Flowers are chosen by customers for their [[scent]] as well as their look.

chinese: [C, usu. sing.] （女人的）胸部
in a way that involves a lot of noise, excitement, activity, or violence 骚乱地；骚动地；混乱地；激动地
examples: e.g. They gathered [[tumultuously]] around him and demanded to know how he had accomplished it.

chinese: tall or long and thin in an attractive way 苗条的；修长的；纤细的
examples: e.g. The dress is for my daughter who's about my height but more [[slender]].

chinese: 1) looking as if you do not understand or are not paying attention 茫然的；失神的
examples: e.g. The maid's [[vacant]] expression was replaced momentarily by one of greedy expectation, shortly followed by disappointment.；e.g. All three sets of houses are [[vacant]], and she's making no attempt to rent them out.

chinese: 2) (seat, room, etc.) empty and available for sb. to use （座位、房间）空的，未被占用的
examples: e.g. The maid's [[vacant]] expression was replaced momentarily by one of greedy expectation, shortly followed by disappointment.；e.g. All three sets of houses are [[vacant]], and she's making no attempt to rent them out.

chinese: [U] a feeling of extreme fear 恐惧；惊恐
examples: e.g. She shook with [[terror]] whenever she was about to fly in a plane by herself.

chinese: [C, usu. sing.] the regular movement of blood as the heart pumps it round the body 脉搏
examples: e.g. The doctor said he was in danger — his breathing was shallow and his [[pulse]] was weak.

chinese: very wrong, immoral, or unfair 极端错误的；道德败坏的；极不公正的
examples: e.g. I'd like to make a complaint — it's [[monstrous]] to charge that much for a hotel room.

chinese: 1) extremely happy and proud 兴高采烈的；得意洋洋的
examples: e.g. We were absolutely [[exalted]] when we learned of your daughter's career success.；e.g. Leith doubted that she would ever meet a man in such a highly [[exalted]] position.

chinese: 2) having a very high rank; highly respected 显贵的；高贵的
examples: e.g. We were absolutely [[exalted]] when we learned of your daughter's career success.；e.g. Leith doubted that she would ever meet a man in such a highly [[exalted]] position.

chinese: refuse to consider sb.'s idea, opinion, etc. because you think it is not serious, true or important 拒绝考虑；不理会
examples: e.g. The government has [[dismissed]] criticism that the country's health policy is a mess.

chinese: [C] a series of people or things 一连串的人（或物）
examples: e.g. We've had an endless [[procession]] of new secretaries in the office since Amy left.

chinese: [U] determination to do sth. even though it is difficult or other people oppose it 坚持；执着；执意
examples: e.g. The teacher kept saying that skill comes only with practice, patience and [[persistence]].

chinese: 1) [C, U] (fml.) a clear explanation or understanding of a particular subject （对某一主题的）阐明，理解
examples: e.g. In that flash of [[illumination]], he realized where he had gone wrong in his decision-making.；e.g. The only [[illumination]] came from a small window high in the opposite wall.

chinese: 2) [U] lighting provided by a lamp, light, etc. 光亮；照明
examples: e.g. In that flash of [[illumination]], he realized where he had gone wrong in his decision-making.；e.g. The only [[illumination]] came from a small window high in the opposite wall.

chinese: (knelt, knelt; kneeled, kneeled) be in or move into a position where your body is resting on your knees 跪着；跪下
examples: e.g. She [[knelt]] on the floor and put more wood on the fire so that the room would be warmer.

chinese: [C] a magical liquid that is supposed to cure people of illness, make them younger, etc. 灵丹妙药；不老药
examples: e.g. You fool, it's yet another health product claiming to be the [[elixir]] of youth.

chinese: [C, U] a violent protest by a crowd of people 暴乱；骚乱
examples: e.g. The police were able to take preventive action and avoid a possible [[riot]].

chinese: [C] a quick uncontrolled shaking movement 战栗；颤抖
examples: e.g. As she turned away from the house into the lane, she gave a [[shudder]] of relief.

chinese: [C, U] the act of asking sb. for sth. continuously in an annoying or unreasonable way 强求
examples: e.g. Unable to withstand my [[importunity]], he would make out drafts for me to copy.

chinese: 1) extremely excited 特别激动的；极度兴奋的
examples: e.g. He will be attending next week's Grammy Awards in [[feverish]] anticipation.；e.g. You ought to be careful about this kind of [[feverish]] cold — it often kicks back.

chinese: 2) suffering from a fever 发烧的；发热的
examples: e.g. He will be attending next week's Grammy Awards in [[feverish]] anticipation.；e.g. You ought to be careful about this kind of [[feverish]] cold — it often kicks back.

chinese: 1) [U] the proud or excited feeling you get when you have won sth. or been successful 成功的满足感；胜利的喜悦之情
examples: e.g. My father returned in [[triumph]] from the annual sales of the department store with a half-price TV.；e.g. If confirmed by longer and larger clinical trials, this will rightly be hailed as a scientific [[triumph]].

chinese: 2) [C] an important victory or success after a difficult struggle 胜利；成功；成就
examples: e.g. My father returned in [[triumph]] from the annual sales of the department store with a half-price TV.；e.g. If confirmed by longer and larger clinical trials, this will rightly be hailed as a scientific [[triumph]].

chinese: in a way that is not conscious or deliberate 不知不觉地；非故意地
examples: e.g. Many parents [[unwittingly]] place their children in danger by not making sure they wear seat belts.

chinese: hold sb. / sth. tightly with your hands 握紧；抱紧
examples: e.g. She would often [[clasp]] her hands behind her head and muse when she could have a house of her own.

chinese: (fml.) move from a higher level to a lower one 从···下来；下降
examples: e.g. I heard his footsteps [[descending]] the stairs — he must have finished his work.

chinese: [C] （房子或公寓大门的）碰锁钥匙
in a way that seems calm and in control of your feelings 镇静地
examples: e.g. It is difficult to think [[composedly]] when you are being attacked by mosquitoes.

chinese: make a small hole in or through sth., using an object with a sharp point 刺入；刺穿；刺破
examples: e.g. The chef taught him to steam the corn until it can easily be [[pierced]] with a fork.

chinese: 1) (sound) high, sharp and unpleasant 尖锐的；刺耳的
examples: e.g. Maggie let out a [[piercing]] scream as she saw the truck speeding toward her.；e.g. Cloudy and unfocused for a moment, his eyes quickly regained their normal [[piercing]] clarity.

chinese: 2) sb. with piercing eyes is looking at you and seems to know what you are thinking 敏锐的；有洞察力的
examples: e.g. Maggie let out a [[piercing]] scream as she saw the truck speeding toward her.；e.g. Cloudy and unfocused for a moment, his eyes quickly regained their normal [[piercing]] clarity.

chinese: make the effort to do sth. 花费力气（做某事）
examples: e.g. There is an old saying: "Take the time to stop and smell the flowers."

chinese: be important or valuable 有价值；有重要性
examples: e.g. When I first came to college, I realized that brainpower didn't [[count]] for much.

chinese: (spoken) used when sb. is telling sb. else how important it is to do sth. or not to do sth. 天哪（表示某事很重要）
examples: e.g. For heaven's sake, don't be late. Otherwise, we won't be able to catch the plane.

chinese: look at, listen to, feel, or smell sth. in order to enjoy it 享受地看（听，感觉，嗅）；品味；欣赏
examples: e.g. She just sat there, [[drinking]] in the stunning view of the sunset.

chinese: (imagination, emotions, thoughts, etc.) go out of control （想象力）自由驰骋；（情感、思绪等）不受约束
examples: e.g. They have let their imagination [[run]] riot to create new computer games.

chinese: after a long time 最后；终于
examples: e.g. At length she became uneasy, and woke up the boy and asked, "Do you know where your dad is?"

chinese: 马拉德（人名）
约瑟芬（人名）
理查兹（人名）
布伦特利 • 马拉德（人名）
路易丝（人名）
